# @beep-it/checkout-widget — LLM Guide

Purpose: React checkout component for BEEP. Browser-only, uses publishable key and public endpoints.

Install
```bash
npm install @beep-it/checkout-widget @beep-it/sdk-core
```

Props
- publishableKey: string (beep_pk_…)
- labels: { scanQr: string; paymentLabel?: string }
- assets: Array< { assetId: string; quantity: number } | { name: string; price: string; quantity?: number; description?: string } >
- serverUrl?: string (defaults to production)
- primaryColor?: string

Usage
```tsx
import { CheckoutWidget } from '@beep-it/checkout-widget';

<CheckoutWidget
  publishableKey="beep_pk_…"
  labels={{ scanQr: 'Scan to pay', paymentLabel: 'My Store' }}
  assets={[ { assetId: 'uuid', quantity: 1 }, { name: 'Custom', price: '12.50' } ]}
  serverUrl="https://api.justbeep.it"
/>
```

Behavior
- Calls POST /v1/widget/payment-session and GET /v1/widget/payment-status/:referenceKey behind the scenes via @beep-it/sdk-core BeepPublicClient.
- Items with { name, price } are created as products server-side (persisted).
- Endpoints are CORS-open; no server proxy required.

Notes
- Never use beep_sk_* in props. Only beep_pk_*.
- Mixed assets (existing + on-the-fly) must share the same merchant and token.
